definitions.body: wheat (NH id., Aram. [[חִנְטִין]], [[חִיטְּתָא]], h.et.to0; Ar. hint.ah;un);—abs. ´[[ח]] Ex 9:32 + 6 t.; pl. [[חִטִּים]] Ge 30:14 + 20 t.; [[חִטִּין]] Ez Eze 4:9; cstr. [[חִטֵּי]] Ez Eze 27:17; —wheat, sg. chiefly poet., of growing wheat Ex 9:32 (E), De 8:8, Job 31:40, Joe 1:11; sown Is 28:25; food-product De 32:14 (´[[חֵלֶב כִּלְיוֹת ח]] kidney-fat of wheat, i.e. the choicest, v. [[חֵלֶב]]), ´[[חֵלֶב ח]] Ps 81:17 (cf. Ps 147:14 infr.); elsewh. pl.; wheat as sown Je 12:13; wheat-harvest ´[[קְחִיר ח]] Ge 30:14 (J), Ex 34:22 (JE), Ju Jdg 15:1, 1Sa 6:13, 1Sa 12:17, Ru 2:23, + 2Sa 24:15 where insert acc. to LXX We Dr; wheat threshed Ju Jdg 6:11, 1 Ch 20:21 cf. v:23; measured 1Ki 5:25 = 2Ch 2:9 ([[חטים מַכּוֹת]], rd. [[מַכּׂלֶת]] ´[[ח]] as 1Ki 5:25 = wheat for food Th Be Ke after Vrss), v:2Ch 5:14, 2Ch 27:5, Ez Eze 45:13; stored (with barley, oil and honey) Je 41:8; for food 2Sa 17:28, [[חֵלֶב חִטִּים]] Ps 147:14 (cf. Ps 81:14 supr.); [[לֽקְחֵי חִטִּים]] 2Sa 4:6 (rd. ´[[סׂקְלָה ח]] LXX We Dr); ´[[סׂלֶת ח]] fine wheaten flour Ex 29:2 (P); Ez Eze 4:9 ([[חִטִּין]], Aram. pl.) mixed with barley, beans, lentils, etc., and made into bread.
